refnamediv.refpurpose: binary search (aka dichotomous search in french)

listitem.para: a real (row or column) vector with n components in strictly increasing order val(1) < val(2) < ... < val(n)
a real vector or matrix with the same dimensions than X
a real vector with the same format than val (but with n-1 components in the case ch="c")

refsection.title: Description
refsection.para: This function is useful to search in an ordered table and/or to count the number of components of a vector falling in some classes (a class being an interval or a value).
By default or when ch="c", this is the interval case, that is, for each X(i) search in which of the n-1 intervals it falls, the intervals being defined by:
refsection.programlisting: I1 = [val(1), val(2)] Ik = (val(k), val(k+1)] for 1 < k <= n-1 ;

listitem.para: is the interval number of X(i) (0 if X(i) is not in [val(1),val(n)])
is the number of components of X which are in Ik
is the number of components of X which are not in [val(1),val(n)]

refsection.para: When ch="d" case, this is the discrete case, that is, for each X(i) search if it is equal to one val(k) and:

listitem.para: is equal to the index of the component of val which matches X(i) (ind(i) = k if X(i)=val(k)) or 0 if X(i) is not in val.
is the number of components of X equal to val(k)
is the number of components of X which are not in the set {val(1),...,val(n)}
